metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22759 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description: If a document created a sandboxed iframe withoutallow-scripts, and subsequently appended an element to theiframe's document that e.g. had a JavaScript event handler - the eventhandler would have run despite the iframe's sandbox. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 97, Thunderbird < 91.6, and Firefox ESR < 91.6. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22759` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1 firefox-geckodriver - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1 firefox-mozsymbols - 97.0+build2-0ubuntu1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '97.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.6.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in esm-apps/jammy is affected and may need fixing.
